organic_results.title: Students and the Politics of Reality
organic_results.snippet: During the period in which student movements on campus were at their height, students participated in a study, presumably to ascertain attitudes towards campus life. The study attempted to make explicit the very processes of negotiating for reality. By using confederates, subjects were confronted with a choice between accepting the officially sponsored faculty version of their activity as work assignment or rejecting this as merely another experimental situation. A substantial tendency to accept the officially sponsored …

publication_info.summary: L Rubin, E Weinstein, H Faberman - Sociology of Education, 1975 - JSTOR
